Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there will be a Friday the 13th in March and a full moon in the last week of the month.
Understate: The claim understates the significance of the events by implying that they are occurring in the same week, when in fact they are not.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is not backed by any evidence or sources.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that there will be a time change, full moon, and Friday the 13th in the same week, which is not true.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the events mentioned in the claim are not happening in the same week and are incorrect.
